paper_abstract: A step-stress accelerated life test for two stress variables is developed. The time to failure follows the Weibull distribution, and the test is subject to termination at a predetermined time, leading to censored failure data. An optimum test plan is developed to determine the test interval for each combination of stress levels. The scale parameter of the Weibull distribution for each combination of stress levels is defined as a log linear function of the stress levels. The optimal criterion is defined to minimize the asymptotic variance of the maximum likelihood estimator of the life for a specified reliability.
paper_title: Optimum bivariate step-stress accelerated life test for censored data
